title: Tackling Combinatorial Distribution Shift: A Matrix Completion Perspective. (arXiv:2307.06457v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Obtaining rigorous statistical guarantees for generalization under distribution shift remains an open and active research area. We study a setting we call combinatorial distribution shift, where (a) under the test- and training-distributions, the labels $z$ are determined by pairs of features $(x,y)$, (b) the training distribution has coverage of certain marginal distributions over $x$ and $y$ separately, but (c) the test distribution involves examples from a product distribution over $(x,y)$ that is {not} covered by the training distribution. Focusing on the special case where the labels are given by bilinear embeddings into a Hilbert space $H$: $\mathbb{E}[z \mid x,y ]=\langle f_{\star}(x),g_{\star}(y)\rangle_{{H}}$, we aim to extrapolate to a test distribution domain that is $not$ covered in training, i.e., achieving bilinear combinatorial extrapolation. tldr: 该论文研究了组合分布偏移的问题，提出了基于矩阵补全的解决方法。通过在特殊情况下的双线性嵌入，实现对训练中未涵盖的测试分布进行外推。这个设置将缺失非随机数据的矩阵补全问题广义化。
